Detailed Description

Stores the set of all normalized series, which do not have certain tonal errors.

This class can be used to generate a complete set of all normalized series. By convention (and without loss of generality) the first note of each series is Note::TONE_MIN. Once all valid series are found, this class provides an interface, which is equivalent to the STL container const std::set<CompactSeries>.

The testing for tonal pharses is done via Series::FindError(int)const. The testing whether the series is normalized is done via Series::IsNormalized()const.

See also:
CompactSeries, Series

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SortedCS::SortedCS (  int  _iTE = Series::TE_DEFAULT,
size_t  _iS = 0
)  [inline, explicit]
 

create empty list

Parameters:
_iTE combination of Series::TonalError, which makes a series invalid
_iS guess of the number of valid series, that will be found
This c'tor just initalizes the class. The parameter _iTE controls, which series will not be taken into the list. The parameter _iS can be used to reserve the correct ammount of memory in advance. This is done via std::vector<CompactSeries>::reserve(size_type).

Member Function Documentation

bool SortedCS::Step (   )  [inline]
 

perform a single calculation step

Return values:
false the last step has been performed
true the last step has not yet been performed
Example: 
 SortedCS scs;
 while(scs.Step());
Note:
The number of steps strongly depends on the value of GetTonalError()const.
